contentrichtext.text: {{main|ISO 3166-2}} '''ISO 3166-2:EC''' is the entry for [[Ecuador]] in [[ISO 3166-2]], part of the [[ISO 3166]] [[standardization|standard]] published by the [[International Organization for Standardization]] (ISO), which defines [[code]]s for the names of the principal [[country subdivision|subdivision]]s (e.g., [[province]]s or [[state (administrative division)|state]]s) of all [[country|countries]] coded in [[ISO 3166-1]]. Currently for Ecuador, ISO 3166-2 codes are defined for [[provinces of Ecuador|24 provinces]]. Each code consists of two parts, separated by a hyphen. The first part is <tt>EC</tt>, the [[ISO 3166-1 alpha-2]] code of Ecuador. The second part is one or two letters, currently used in [[vehicle registration plates of Ecuador|vehicle registration plates]], with a few exceptions. ==Current codes== Subdivision names are listed as in the ISO 3166-2 standard published by the ISO 3166 Maintenance Agency (ISO 3166/MA). ''Click on the button in the header to sort each column.'' {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Code ! Subdivision name |- | <tt>EC-A</tt> | [[Azuay Province|Azuay]] |- | <tt>EC-B</tt> | [[Bolívar Province (Ecuador)|Bolívar]] |- | <tt>EC-F</tt> | {{sort|Can~ar|[[Cañar Province|Cañar]]}} |- | <tt>EC-C</tt> | [[Carchi Province|Carchi]] |- | <tt>EC-H</tt> | [[Chimborazo Province|Chimborazo]] |- | <tt>EC-X</tt> | [[Cotopaxi Province|Cotopaxi]] |- | <tt>EC-O</tt> | [[El Oro Province|El Oro]] |- | <tt>EC-E</tt> | [[Esmeraldas Province|Esmeraldas]] |- | <tt>EC-W</tt> | [[Galápagos Province|Galápagos]] |- | <tt>EC-G</tt> | [[Guayas Province|Guayas]] |- | <tt>EC-I</tt> | [[Imbabura Province|Imbabura]] |- | <tt>EC-L</tt> | [[Loja Province|Loja]] |- | <tt>EC-R</tt> | [[Los Ríos Province|Los Ríos]] |- | <tt>EC-M</tt> | [[Manabí Province|Manabí]] |- | <tt>EC-S</tt> | [[Morona-Santiago Province|Morona-Santiago]] |- | <tt>EC-N</tt> | [[Napo Province|Napo]] |- | <tt>EC-D</tt> | [[Orellana Province|Orellana]] |- | <tt>EC-Y</tt> | [[Pastaza Province|Pastaza]] |- | <tt>EC-P</tt> | [[Pichincha Province|Pichincha]] |- | <tt>EC-SE</tt> | [[Santa Elena Province|Santa Elena]] |- | <tt>EC-SD</tt> | [[Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas Province|Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas]] |- | <tt>EC-U</tt> | [[Sucumbíos Province|Sucumbíos]] |- | <tt>EC-T</tt> | [[Tungurahua Province|Tungurahua]] |- | <tt>EC-Z</tt> | [[Zamora-Chinchipe Province|Zamora-Chinchipe]] |} ==Changes== The following changes to the entry have been announced in newsletters by the ISO 3166/MA since the first publication of ISO 3166-2 in 1998: {| class="wikitable" |- ! Newsletter ! Date issued ! Description of change in newsletter ! Code/Subdivision change |- | id="I-4" | [http://www.iso.org/iso/iso_3166-2_newsletter_i-4_en.pdf {{nowrap|Newsletter I-4}}] | {{nowrap|2002-12-10}} | Addition of one province | style=white-space:nowrap | '''Subdivisions added:'''<br /> <tt>EC-D</tt> [[Orellana Province|Orellana]] |- | id="II-2" | [http://www.iso.org/iso/iso_3166-2_newsletter_ii-2_2010-06-30.pdf {{nowrap|Newsletter II-2}}] | {{nowrap|2010-06-30}} | Update of the administrative structure and of the list source | style=white-space:nowrap | '''Subdivisions added:'''<br /> <tt>EC-SE</tt> [[Santa Elena Province|Santa Elena]]<br /> <tt>EC-SD</tt> [[Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas Province|Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas]] |} ==See also== * [[Subdivisions of Ecuador]] * [[List of FIPS region codes (D-F)#EC: Ecuador|FIPS region codes of Ecuador]] ==External links== * [http://www.statoids.com/uec.html Provinces of Ecuador], Statoids.com {{ISO 3166}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Iso 3166-2:Ec}} [[Category:ISO 3166|2:EC]] [[Category:Provinces of Ecuador|*ISO 3166-2]] [[Category:Ecuador geography-related lists]]
